title: Letrizmo!
content:
I hadn’t heard of this fellow before, but I like the work! His site is called [Letrizmo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215185855/http:/www.letrizmo.com/) and there are a few more interesting faces in the works. Check it out!

 [‹ Chinese Type Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215185855/http:/typophile.com/node/40032 "Go to previous forum topic") [Business newspaper font redesign ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215185855/http:/typophile.com/node/40083 "Go to next forum topic")
author: crossgrove

comments.content: Mexican typography makes me want to learn Espanol again.
Especially after that Typecon presentation. Does anyone know a good source to purchase a wide range of Mexican/Latino typefaces? (Besides the obvious like Myfonts?)

Dan, you could try Veer, who sell a lot of the work by [Sudtipos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071215185855/http:/www.sudtipos.com/home).

And I don’t know if you can purchase any fonts there, but [Letras Latinas](http://web.archive.org/) has many faces on view from all over South America.
